pullRequest.body:
It is positive when `IsRegular x` (which requires weaker constraints on `R` than `IsUnit x` or `x ≠ 0`)

---

nodes.body:
### PR summary [03e44da177](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13748/commits/03e44da177124c05569bdf81388d1b5fd7bd7e4f)

#### Import changes

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Star.Basic | 483 | 484 | +1 (+0.21%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Star.Order | 506 | 507 | +1 (+0.20%) |

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsLeftRegular.star`
`+ IsRegular.star`
`+ IsRightRegular.star`
`+ isLeftRegular_star_iff`
`+ isRegular_iff`
`+ isRegular_star_iff`
`+ isRightRegular_star_iff`
`+ mul_star_self_pos`
`+ star_mul_self_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

This is weird to me because `IsRegular` seems *so* much stronger than `x ≠ 0`. In fact, `(hx : 0 ≤ x) (hx' : IsRegular x)` is basically the definition of *strictly positive* in a C⋆-algebra (although there are other equivalent ones). Nevertheless, I think there's nothing wrong with having these.

bors merge

> This is weird to me because `IsRegular` seems _so_ much stronger than `x ≠ 0`.

I think I stated things unclearly; what I meant is that `[DivisionRing R] (x : R) (hx : x ≠ 0)` is a much stronger requirement than `[Ring R] (x : R) (hx : IsRegular R)`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9551675934/job/26326573725)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9551675934/job/26326573980)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: positivity of `star x * x`
